definitions.definition: A sheet of paper or cardboard with a written or printed announcement on one side for display in a public place.
A public proclamation; a manifesto or edict issued by authority.
Permission given by authority; a license.
definitions.example: to give a placard to do something

definitions.definition: An extra plate on the lower part of the breastplate or backplate of armour.
A kind of stomacher, often adorned with jewels, worn in the fifteenth century and later.
The woodwork and frame of the door of a closet etc.
